p: A genetic study of ecologically relevant loci in 13 alpine plant species in the European Alps found that, after accounting for broad spatial patterns, temperature and/or precipitation variables were the primary drivers of genetic variation in all but one species ( Manel et al., 2012). In contrast, a genetic study of putatively neutral loci in three tree species in Central America found different drivers in different species ( Poelchau and Hamrick, 2012). In one species, an integrated environmental measure, incorporating temperature and precipitation, was the primary driver; in the second species the primary driver was geographic distance; in the third species the results were ambiguous ( Poelchau and Hamrick, 2012). This indicates that environmental drivers of within-species genetic diversity are likely to be somewhat species specific.
